FuncDef:
The cmu-switch command configures the ID, name, and alarm type for the switch parameter monitored by the environment monitoring unit.
The undo cmu-switch command cancels the configuration.
The cmu-switch reset fog command resets the fog sensor.
By default, no cmu-switch is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Cmu switch ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 6.
0: smoke sensor1: IN12: IN23: IN34: IN45: IN56: IN6

Specify cmu switch name.
The value is a string of 1 to 24 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

The object monitored by this sensor.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The device provides the environment monitoring function to monitor the environment change. In this case, the maintenance personnel do not need to implement on-site environment monitoring. When detecting the environment change, the device reports an alarm to the NMS. The maintenance personnel can thus adjust environment parameters accordingly. This can effectively reduce the maintenance expenditure of the equipment room.
When the fog or entrance guard system needs to be monitored, the alarm type can be configured on the device. This enables the device to generate alarms when the switch ID becomes 0 or 1.
If a Huawei smoke sensor is used, run the cmu-switch 0 name door alarm-mode 0 object fog command, with alarm-mode being set to 0.
Configuration Impact
Environment monitoring is an optional configuration and is not included in the basic configuration.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the device equipped with the CMU module.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
